MEL: You’ve met the Doctor, then? Do you know where he is?
VULQUEN: Yes, he’s with Celia. They came to see me about the Red tape.
DRAUN: What is that? Is that something to do with this Red man?
VULQUEN: Very probably. It’s something very special. It’s going to prove that we can all commit violence, and that Whitenoise is fallible. If the Doctor can get hold of it.
NUANE: You don’t need a tape to know that. We’ve seen it first-hand.
VULQUEN: You can commit it first-hand if you want. You’re not denied it, so there’s no pleasure in it.
MEL: There’s never anything pleasurable about strangulation.
VULQUEN: Don’t you ever want what you don’t have? Aren’t you the least bit intrigued about things you’ve never experienced?
MEL: Well, yes, some things, but I don’t want to experience everything. I limit myself to the good things.
VULQUEN: There’s the difference between us. I want no limitations.
DRAUN: This is different, Vi. I tried to hurt Mel. It wasn’t me, it was something inside me, inhabiting me, reaching out. I hated her. I wanted to kill her.
VULQUEN: So, it’s happening down there as well.
MEL: I’m afraid so. There’s something very rotten at the heart of this state.
VULQUEN: Well, it’s fortunate that you survived the experience, my dear.
NUANE: That’s because she fought back.
VULQUEN: How exciting.
DRAUN: She isn’t chipped.
MEL: Why do I feel so vulnerable when you say that?
VULQUEN: Not chipped? You’re sure? My dear, I didn’t realise I was in such danger. Please, come and sit down. You're very welcome.
MEL: Not this again. Look, I’m not going to hurt you. I only want to find the Doctor.
VULQUEN: But the point is, you could hurt me, and I wouldn’t mind. I don’t think I should tell you where the Doctor is. I think you should force it from me.
NUANE: Come on, Vulquen, drop your petty obsession for one moment. There is a more serious situation
NUANE: here.
VULQUEN: No, this is wonderful. Pure, unadulterated violence, unchipped, unchecked. You can do anything, my dear.
MEL: Anything but get a straight answer. Won't you just tell me where I can find the Doctor?
DRAUN: Come on, Vi. It’s important.
VULQUEN: Mel, I want you to hurt me.
MEL: Oh, fine. I'll find him myself, then. Ah! Please, let me go!
VULQUEN: No, hurt me. I want your violence.
LETEREL: [OC]: Are you sure you're all right, Uviol?
UVIOL: [OC]: Yes, I’m fine.
LETEREL: [OC]: Uviol!
BLUE: Pause, Whitenoise. Are you all right to watch this, Doctor?
DOCTOR: No. But then, I shouldn't be. I killed that woman.
CELIA: It was the Red, not you. You only felt what it was like.
DOCTOR: I shouldn’t have been able to feel it, Celia. There’s something in me that he tapped into. Maybe part of me wants to be violent. Play.
LETEREL: [OC]: Uviol! Let go of... What are you doing?
UVIOL: [OC]: I’m hurting you.
DOCTOR: [OC]: I haven't felt like this for a long time. It feels so good.
UVIOL: [OC]: Red. So Red. Red.
DOCTOR: I shouldn’t have allowed that. I should have been stronger.
CELIA: Do something about it now, then.
DOCTOR: Forward. Play.
DOCTOR: [OC]: No, you cannot make me do this!
UVIOL: [OC]: Red. Red. Red.

BLUE: See if you can tune it in, Whitenoise.
BLUE: [OC]: A time traveller? We haven't had one of those here before. It’s fortunate that we found you when we did. Who knows what damage you could have caused, Celia.
CELIA: Fortunate. I was edited!
DOCTOR: Time traveller.
BLUE: [OC]: Don’t worry, it doesn’t hurt. You’ll feel much better about things soon.
CELIA: [OC]: Please, let me go. I'll leave straight away.
BLUE: [OC]: Your time capsule is in pieces. You’re staying, so you'll have to be chipped.

BLUE: [OC]: Here we go.
BLUE: [OC]: What is that? What’s she saying, Whitenoise?
DOCTOR: Stop! Go back. Slow that down.
CELIA: [OC]: Red. Red. Red. Red.

elements.text: [Part Four]
Then we've found him.
But how?
How indeed. You travel in Time, but you’re human. Unless... What kind of capsule did she arrive in, Whitenoise?
A mere metallic shell. Analysis suggested it was not technologically advanced in itself.
Show me. You must have a recorded image of it.
Do it, Whitenoise. There.
Oh no.
Please don’t say that. Help me. Get him out of me. Why is he in me?

I recognise the technology, which places you, Celia, from somewhere around the 45" century. An era of technocrats and machine-driven life. If I remember correctly - and I usually do - your people can engineer a biological-temporal link to the machines you use, like the one that brought you here.
Why would they do that?
It enables them to think like a machine. Therefore, Celia’s ability to link to Whitenoise isn’t a
coincidence. It’s inbuilt. Her capsule was just a shell to shield her for the journey.
You mean...
Yes. You are, to all intents and purposes, the actual time machine yourself, Celia.
She is biologically advanced enough to manipulate Time?

She was, but you had to chip her, and so neatly erased that ability. When you brought down all her barriers and unwittingly let out her violence, it corrupted your own systems and fed on all your subjects’ mass wish for harm.
But why is it so focused in you?
I’m also a time traveller. It’s trying to find the link. But the killer knows you, Celia. It always comes home. It’s comfortable inside you.
But so much violence. Where did it come from, Celia?
I don’t know. I can’t remember. I must have killed all those people. All those people. I don’t want this, Doctor. This isn’t a good feeling. Whitenoise, please take it away. Edit me.
No. Keep it, Celia. Don’t let the Red get the better of you. Get angry. And you let her, Whitenoise. Use that anger against the killer. We know where he is now, and there’s Argh!
Doctor!
(in pain) He’s jumped. Red. Red. Red. I want your violence.
Stop it. Stop it!
The Doctor is Red-lining. Subject 0357 Matriarch Vi Vulquen is in parallel Red condition.
+ VULQUEN: Have you ever hurt someone badly before, Melanie?
That’s not you. It’s Vi?
Have you ever hurt someone badly before, Melanie? Ever caused someone to be injured or killed?
You’re not Vi Vulquen. What are you?
Is that what happened to me?
Yes. But it’s not you and it’s not her.
This is her. This is all her. She finally has everything she wanted.
Vi, if you’re in there, listen to me. You’ve never actually hurt anyone, have you? You don’t want to kill.
I don’t want to kill. I want to be hurt. She only wants cuts and bruises, lightweight.
Get out of her. Get out of Vi now. You’re making her say these things. She doesn’t really want them. She doesn’t know how painful it feels.
And we can teach her that.
You’re outnumbered three to one. What can you do here?

Oh Mel, always on the side of right. Is the Doctor always right, though? Every act of violence he commits, you’re there beside him, an accomplice. You’d never burn whole planets, leave a people to die for the greater good. You’d never push someone down the stairs. Would you?
Nothing you can say can make me doubt the Doctor. I can do that for myself. And I won’t hurt you without a reason.
Red. Red. Hurt me.
Red. Red. Hurt you. Hurt you, Mel.
Mel cries out.
Red. Red. Hurt you. Hurt you, Mel.
Fight him, Doctor. You wanted me to be angry. I’m angry. But you have even more reason to be. He’s using you, making you enjoy his killings. You’re his puppet. Fight back.
I cannot allow this to continue. My programming is being countermanded by Celia’s ability for anger. I, I am frightened.
Calm down, Whitenoise. Focus. You must focus.
I cannot see. There’s so much Red.
Doctor?
Red. Red. Ah! Celia, he’s so strong now. He’s got Mel again. Help her.
How?
The killer returns to you. You can pull him back. Go to Vi’s habitat. Stop him, please. I can’t anymore. It’s up to you.
Okay, Doctor. I’m going to fix this. (leaves)
You should not have let her go. We could have waited until the killer returned to Celia after it had killed. Trapped in her, I could then have killed him.
And killed her as well. The Doctor’s trying to stop all these killings.
Besides, we know it’s not after her.

Synchronised as I am to your Red-lining, analysis suggests that the killer is not interested in your companion after all. With each new killing it is becoming more of a real concept, and you are becoming converted into the digital, into machine code. You are a time traveller like Celia. You can take it away. It wants
you, Doctor.
The Doctor screams in pain.
How, how does it feel, Vulquen, hurting me?
It feels... red.
It’s no use, Mel. You can’t get through. She’s wanted this for so long she’s completely given in to the urge.
Let her go, Vi, or I'll use Little Babe.
That’s what she wants, Draun.
Then we should give it to her. I’m not letting this happen again.
Give me the knife, Draun.
What are you going to do?
Kill her. We have to to stop it.
Nuane, don’t!
I’m not going to stand here and watch you die, Mel. And certainly not by Vi’s hand. She’s hurt too many people already.
Door opens.
You? Where did you spring from?
Red, get out of my friend. You’re mine. You belong to me.
A Red devil, like Vosine saw.
CELIA-RED: Celia, fortunate that we found you.
If you want to hurt someone, hurt me. I deserve it.
CELIA-RED: Can’t hurt you. Can’t hurt Celia.
Then come home. I’m very angry with you.
CELIA-RED: Angry? Good. Want Red. Want lots of Red.
I can show you all the Red you want. I can show you all your killings. Would you like that? CELIA-RED: Yes. Lots of Red.
Then come home.
Watch out!
Oh!
(sighs) Thank you, Celia.
The Red has returned to Celia. I must complete my programming. I must kill it, burn out the chip.
No. You can’t kill it without hurting her, and that’s against your programming.
Celia Fortunaté is the cause of all this.
No, Whitenoise, you’re the cause of all this.
It’s cracking up, Chief Blue. Fix it.
I, I must carry out my programming. We have discovered the killer’s hiding place. We must destroy it to prevent any more violence. I won't allow it to manifest again.
That’s not programming. That’s murder.
One subject’s death for the good of the state. You said this yourself, Chief Blue. I am decided.
It’s Celia, isn’t it?
What did you do?
I stopped him.
Just in time to stop Nuane doing something stupid.
Is Vi all right?
She doesn’t deserve to be.
Whatever your problem with Vi is, Nuane, just drop it. Her pulse is slow, but she’s still breathing. She should be okay. You’re the one the Doctor was with, aren’t you? Is he safe?
He will be, now that I can hold the killer.
He went into you, but you didn’t change like the others, like me.

No. It’s my fault, you see. I let him out. I killed all those people. I can feel him inside, now that I’m aware of him, squirming, ready to be unleashed as soon as he feels someone’s lust for violence. Oh!
What is it? What’s wrong?
My head. My chip. It’s burning. Whitenoise.
He'll want the killer gone.
He’s trying to kill you? I thought that was against his programming.
Desperate times, desperate measures.
It’s all right. I’m not frightened of him anymore. I deserve it.
No, you don't. It’s not your fault, it’s this society.
No, it’s me. I want the Red dead. I want him to have his own violence directed against him. If that means I have to die too, so be it. Do it, Whitenoise. Do it! Ah!
Celia screams, a brief electronic fizz then thud.
No! What have you done, Whitenoise?
I am functioning within all parameters of programming.
You’ve just become a killer. You’re no longer even in control of yourself. Preservation routines are now functioning at the cost of lives, and all because you're frightened.
There is no longer a need to be frightened. The killer has been dealt with.

Dealt with? No, you dealt with Celia. The killer is not so easy to kill as a human being. You’re a great sentinel machine with eyes and ears everywhere, and you haven’t been listening to me. I told you that killing the host won’t stop the Red.
The killer’s gone back into Whitenoise.
Yes. Celia may have been able to hold it. Instead, you’ve infected yourself.
I will not allow this violence to exist inside my systems. I will delete it.
You'd have to burn out every chip to be sure.
I have already done it once. It can easily be done again.
Is that you talking, Whitenoise, or the killer inside you?
There will be no killer inside me. Subject 0592, there is something wrong.
[OC]: My chip! Ah! It’s burning!
We've got to stop him.
You’re the technician. Can the chips be deactivated?
Another man dies noisily in the background. More follow.
Yes, but I’m not familiar with the procedure. Whitenoise is mostly self-regulating.
Then you have to override him somehow. Get the Needle to bring Mel and the others here. She’s an expert programmer. She'll help you.
And what are you going to do?
I’m still synchronised with the killer. I can hook myself up to the machine, track him, coax him out.
Be careful, Doctor. In there he’s powerful.
I’m counting on it. He wants me, Chief. If he thinks he can trap me in the machine, turn me into a signal while he occupies my body, then I have a better chance of getting at him too.
You're only delaying. I don’t see how you can stop him.
For that I need Slow. You'll have that, won’t you, Chief Blue?
I don’t take Slow.

Don't try my patience. I know that in order for Slow to have its special qualities, there has to be a temporal element within it. The same temporal makeup as Whitenoise, perhaps. And only you have access to him.
It, it’s a waste product. I’m simply recycling resources. I was put here to assume the continued smooth operation of the machine.
And that includes the gratification of the subjects? Very smooth. Which I might add is not how things are progressing. The Slow, please.
I really don’t have any left. But Vi Vulquen will. She’s a supplier. She always has it.
Then I suggest you get her here now, before Whitenoise kills the entire population of this city.
I don't like the way this building drags us from place to place. What’s wrong with a lift, or just stairs?
So, Vulquen, how was it, your first taste of freedom, of real harm?
I can’t deny that it wasn’t good. To be so out of one’s control is the ultimate luxury. My only regret is that the urge was not satisfied.
You would have liked to kill Mel?
Oh, please understand, I bear you no malice, Mel, but yes, to complete that emotion...
You’re sick, Vulquen. This isn’t about art now. You can’t just stand back and appreciate this from a distance. You're part of it.

To me the art is so much more real than the real thing. You don’t understand. I can’t live in your world, Nuane. I can’t handle the responsibility. I’d rather delude myself. I'd rather be a hypocrite. I know now the pleasure is in being denied.
You’re going to have to change, Vulquen. Whitenoise is corrupted. The whole system and the Needle will collapse with him.
She’s right. You can’t ignore this. We all have to work together now.
There’s no such thing as security any more, Vi. This thing can get into us all. Not even Celia could stop it.
Celia. My poor, dear Celia.
You liked her, didn’t you?
More than you could know. I was never able to tell her.
You were never able to tell me, either.
I’m not sorry I hurt you, Nuane. I got so much more from that than I ever got from you. But I did like Celia.
Then show me how much you cared for her. Help us get rid of this killer once and for all. Help us fix your sentinel machine. Be brave. Make a choice.
Subject 7166...
If I short his security subroutines here, you, Chief Blue, should be able to access deactivication codes for the chips.
We'll have do this the old-fashioned way, by computer console. I’m in.
Door opens.
Doctor.
Mel. So good to see you're safe. Would you mind helping Chief Blue deprogramme Whitenoise?
Er...
How easy would it be for you to programme in a self-destruct algorithm? I’d do it myself, but I’m rather occupied, possibly literally.
Right.
Good. Hello Draun, er Nuane, yes? Hello, Vi Vulquen. I’m not so pleased to see you but I understand you keep Slow for special occasions, and I think today qualifies.
Have it, if you think it will help.
It will. Thank you.
Doctor, be careful. Slow isn’t very pleasant.
Believe me, Mel. The whole experience is not going to be pleasant, but it is necessary.
Hey, what’s wrong with Chief Blue?
No, Whitenoise, not me. Not me. Red’s not in me. Argh!
Subject 0062 Chief Blue, there is something wrong?
Stop it. Stop this, Whitenoise. It’s me he wants. Let me find him for you. Then do as you wish, but do it to me.
Argh! Please, Whitenoise, I thought you were my friend.
You are trying to corrupt my programming. You have become a threat. You must be erased.
Blue screams. Thud.
Mel, it’s all up to you now. You must deactivate the chips. If I don’t come back, you know where the Tardis is.
Doctor, what are you going to do?
Hurry. Vulquen, the Slow. How do I take it?
Via your ear. Like this.
It’s all right, it’s normal. Just creating the crystalline nervous system.
Doctor, don’t you dare martyr yourself in there.
The thought hadn’t occurred to me. The chips, Mel. You must stop...
He’s under.

Where are you, Red? Come out and face me. I’m a Time Lord. I can give you all of Time and Space. Imagine how much violence is out there. We're still linked. I can’t hurt you without hurting myself. And I wouldn’t do that, would I? There you are.
Red. Doctor. Red Doctor. Make the Red Doctor. Want the Red Doctor.
You can have me. Leave the others.
But I like the Red. I need it. I felt the Red. Hurts. I need the Red to hurt. To make me feel alive.
I’m better than all of them. I have destroyed races, destroyed worlds. Sometimes I’ve enjoyed it. What power. Oh, I am capable of so much more violence. Would you like to see?
A trick.
No, it’s real. Just jump into me. I can’t hurt you.
Can’t hurt me. Can’t hurt me. The pretty red girl can. Stop her. Stop Mel.
Stop Mel.
It’s got Nuane. Look out, Mel.
I’ve almost got it, but there’s one tricky command that keeps locking me out. NUANE-RED: Pretty red girl, stop that. It’s my machine now.
I can’t stop. Thousands of lives depend on me not stopping.
NUANE-RED: I'll make you Red.
No. No, you won't.
NUANE-RED: Leave me be, little brother.
Do what you have to, Mel. I'll hold her off.
NUANE-RED: She hates you. She thinks you’re weak. You want the Red, but scared of Red.
Go on, then. Give me the Red. Just leave my sister alone.
Draun, give me your knife.
Don’t you dare, Vi.
She was quite prepared to use it on me. I have no qualms about using it on her.
Stay out of this, Vi.
Stay out of it? You said yourself, I’m already part of this. I can’t live in your world. I want this one. I’ve decided. I want Whitenoise, so I won't let her ruin him.
She’s my sister. I won’t hurt her.
Then she'll kill you. But I will hurt her. I’m making the choice.
NUANE-RED: Can’t hurt me. Can’t hurt me.
Oh, I think I can. Tell me how this feels.
No, don’t. Argh!
Draun!
NUANE-RED: Red. Lots of Red. Little brother, all Red.
No, please, this isn’t necessary. I can give you everything you want.
Red. Red. Draun? Draun. What’s happened to you? What has she done to you? Draun.
Let her go, Red. Enter me. Take my violence. It’s yours.
What’s this?
This, Red? This is my trap. Welcome to Slow.
You cannot hurt me, even though you have so much violence.
Yes. I’ve bottled it up for so long. Now it’s time to let it all out. I can hurt you because I’m also a killer, and I’m going to kill you.
Can't. Can’t. I have achieved synchronicity with you. I return from the ether, the dark space, the incomprehensible.
The dark space? What was Celia?
Something cold. Something cruel. Something bad. She liked me. Used me to hurt lots and lots and lots and lots of people.
I’m happy to say that in the end she didn’t want you. She bettered you, and she paid the price for it.
Poor Celia. My Celia. Dead Celia. Now there’s you, time-travelling Doctor. Want to feed on your violence.
Yes, you’ve got me. You’re very clever. But did I mention that I am a Time Lord? Which means that I have rather a special handle on Time.
You're leaving Red? How?

I’ve just crumbled the crystalline nervous system that Slow creates. But I can keep you trapped in my chip, push you back into the machine, hold you there. My two minutes are up and so are yours. Goodbye.
I will make you Red. I am what you have become.
I’m not afraid of you. I can face my violence. It'll not better me.
Are you sure? Let me show you your Red.
I don’t talk to the dead.
No. No. Red. (receding) Red.
Tape speeding up.
Doctor, you’re back.
Oh, not a pleasant experience at all, Mel. I think I’m much more of a fast-paced Time Lord. Draun, is he...
Draun’s dead.
I’m so sorry.
I... don’t know what to feel. I think I should cry. Is that right, Doctor?
Yes, that’s right.
So you stopped the killer?
Not yet. Oh, not yet! Mel, why haven't you turned off the chips? He’s only seconds behind me. He'll try to come through my chip.
Come and see for yourself. There’s a command override.
Oh, Mel. A programmer of your ability should be able to get through this easily. There!
Easy, was it?
Er, well, if in doubt, Mel, pull the wires.
Which wires?
All of them.
Oh, why does it always come down to the last minute?
Whitenoise slows and stops.
Oh Mel, it’s much more exciting when it’s last minute.
And what about Whitenoise?
Oh, you and your precious sentinel. Well, Doctor? Are we free of it at last?
He’s still operating. The chips have simply been deactivated. There’s a particular ghost in that machine whom you might want to delete. Mel, any luck with that algorithm?
Didn’t need to. One already exists.
Of course. Chief Blue. He must have always foreseen this possibility and put it there, just in case. Then it just comes down to which one of you ladies want to press the button.
What will it do? Will we be in control of the machine?
Press it and find out.
I'll do it.
Beeping starts.
What have you done?
It was a self-destruct button. What do you think it'll do?
It will destroy Whitenoise.
No, it must not be destroyed. I can’t go out there, outside the Needle. I won’t survive.
You'll have to. I imagine the Needle will self-destruct too. We have to find as many survivors as possible and get them out.
Doctor, when I began detonating their chips, they tried to flee. Some may have escaped the Needle, but the majority I... I am sorry.
Don’t be. People like that, people like Vulquen here, they deserve what they get.
No, Nuane. No one deserves (distant boom) It’s started.
Too late to argue morality then, Doctor.
We should have about sixty seconds to reach the Tardis. Run!
The Tardis materialises. Tardis door opens.
I could have used an umbrella earlier.
You always appreciate the things you need the most when you don’t have them. Haven’t you learned that today?
Boom!
Look, the Needle.
It’s dying. It’s a living construct. It was tied to Whitenoise. You people killed him.
Good. Draun would have liked that.
Liked what?
Freeing you, Vi.
Big boom.
Doctor.
It’s all right, Mel. Residual psychic energy. The Red’s gone.
And so is my home. What do I do now?
You should be happy. You have everything you wanted. You can hurt people down here, and be hurt back. It’s real here, not some art form. Here you can develop your anger, Vi.
That’s what frightens me. I won’t be able to live like this. I don’t want that anymore.
We were the same. We learned to come out from under the machine. You'll just have to learn to become human again. I remember you were, once.
You have your violence again. Learn to control it. It’s a part of human nature. It’s a part of you. Well, I think that’s all the loose ends tied. Time for us to go, Mel.
Not quite. What about your chip?
Completely harmless now.
Good. I mean, I know you’re not the violent type.
I could be, Mel. I could be.
Massive explosion.
It’s stopped raining.
Yes. It’s stopped raining.
